meanings.definition: To defeat thoroughly in a game or contest.
meanings.sent1: The team skunked their opponents with a final score of 10-0.
meanings.sent2: The chess champion skunked every challenger that came their way.
meanings.sent3: The video game character skunked all the villains in the virtual world.
meanings.sent4: She skunked her rival in the debate, leaving them speechless.
meanings.sent5: The detective skunked the criminal by solving the case in record time.

meanings.definition: To fail to score in a game or contest.
meanings.sent1: Despite their efforts, the team skunked and couldn't get a single point.
meanings.sent2: The player skunked in the basketball match, missing every shot.
meanings.sent3: The student skunked in the spelling bee, forgetting every word.
meanings.sent4: She skunked in the singing competition, hitting all the wrong notes.
meanings.sent5: The chef skunked in the cooking contest, burning every dish.

meanings.definition: To be intoxicated by alcohol or drugs.
meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he was skunked and couldn't walk straight.
meanings.sent2: She skunked at the party and had to be helped home.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally skunked on a spilled bottle of beer.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel looked like it had skunked on fermented berries.
meanings.sent5: The bear seemed skunked after eating the fermented apples.
